conclusion: Determine the electric field strength at (h, h, -h) due to induced charges.
Point charge +q is located at A(0, 0, h).
Region z ≤ 0 is filled with an infinite conductor.
Electric field inside the conductor is zero.
Find the electric field at (h, h, -h).
Electric field E at distance r from point charge q is E = kq/r² r̂.
Distance r from point charge to (x, y, z) is r = √(x² + y² + (z - h)²).
Unit vector r̂ from point charge to (h, h, -h) is (1/√6, 1/√6, -2/√6).
Electric field at (h, h, -h) due to point charge is E_point charge = kq/(6h²) (1/√6, 1/√6, -2/√6).
Electric field inside conductor must be zero.
Electric field due to induced charges must cancel electric field due to point charge.
Magnitude of electric field due to induced charges is E_induced = kq/(6h²).
Magnitude of electric field strength formed by induced charges at (h, h, -h) is kq/(6h²).
